content.body: surely, anne⊙kn (@ pronounced as "van")

Hixie: there's no technical reason .className couldn't be overridden for SVG elements to return something different. It's just a really confusing. But no more confusing than .className being different in HTML and in SVG
agreed
is .className different in HTML and SVG?
yes
s/is/how is/
string vs token list?
string vs svg animated string value
oh
good lord, why would you use svg animation to animate the class?
wasn't there discussion about changing the svg dom to make it more like the html dom?
or is there enough legacy depending on the current svg dom to make it impossible to change?
maybe the placeholder thing in contenteditable should be an element instead of an attribute?
or maybe not
"This demo uses the Audio Data API in Firefox, and Web Audio in Chrome. Please agree on a single API, browser developers!" https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/demos/detail/audiospank
nice idea; the first multiplayer FPS game playable by blind people that i've heard of
(haven't tried it myself yet)
please join browser development, web developers!
Bah, Ms2ger and annevk aren't here.
We're not good enough for you?
You called?
(Feel free to add that note)
$ grep -aPihc "word-wrap\s*:\s*break-word" stevef-all
$ grep -aEihzc "word-wrap[[:space:]]*:[[:space:]]*break-word" stevef-all
(67 pages out of the top 10,000 use word-wrap:break-word; total occurrences 262)
AryehGregor: ^
Ms3ger, okay, thanks.
Np
goes off to class
http://www.w3.org/TR/ttaf1-dfxp/#vocabulary-namespaces aaaaargh
hello
what's going on with CORS simple headers list?
zcorpan: I believe the translation from spec speak to english of that section is "The WG are as high as a kite"
http://dvcs.w3.org/hg/cors/raw-file/tip/Overview.html#simple-header
"Last-Event-ID" is missed
why is MozMutationObserver prefixed in firefox?
MozMozMutationObserver?
hsivonen: you around?
zcorpan: getting kesteren.nl is hard (it's also a place name) and vankesteren.nl is owned by some web design agency
annev⊙nn then? too ugly? :)
too ugly
could use kesteren.org I guess
argh, why is firstElementChild defined on Element only?
please make the element traversal methods available on more nodes
really?
you want that on DocumentFragment?
yeah, and Document
what is wrong with documentElement?
nextElementSibling i want on all nodes, i think
annevk: i need to check if foo is a document or an element instead of just using firstElementChild
zcorpan: annevk: I've had that use case in the past too
what kind of weird code are you guys writing?
annevk: specifically here: https://bitbucket.org/runeh/unbose/src/9d94749c9236/src/unbose.js#cl-47
annevk: could have just used firstElementChild directy there
so nextElementSibling is available on nodes other than Element?
that code seems wrong
afaict
if (child.nodeType != 1 /*ELEMENT*/) { child = child.nextElementSibling; }
makes child undefined
annevk: if you have foo and want the next element sibling, it makes sense to just use nextElementSibling even if foo is not an element
annevk: hmm, yea, I guess that's not tested enough. But I was going to write what zcorpan just said
I agree with that, I'm just saying this code does not work
annevk: yea
ok i'll file a spec bug
I'm not quite convinced on the others though
annevk: which ones?
first/lastElementChild
oh, and childElementCount should die
if we can kill childElementCount, that's fine with me. if we can't, we might as well make it available on the same places we make .children available
filed https://www.w3.org/Bugs/Public/show_bug.cgi?id=16919
annevk: i think the rationale for this is really the same as for the new mutation methods
jgraham: html5lib, Python 3. This is going to be fun unless we drop Py<2.6 support to explicitly have binary strings.
Almost tempting to go Py3 native and use 3to2.
(As then we fail hard given any Unicode/Bytes mismatch being introduced)
gsnedders: I am happy to drop py<2.6 support and to go python 3 and use 3to2
In fact I'm not aware that there is another approach that sould work
*could
zcorpan: those namespaces are nothing compared to SMIL
http://annevankesteren.nl/2006/03/smil is still a fun read
AryehGregor: I missed that Ms3ger already ok'd a change, a change works for me, just seems overkill
maybe I should do annevk⊙an
that's not that bad
http://w3.markmail.org/search/ public-html is "only" 14k messages behind www-style, despite www-style existing like forever
good morning, Whatwg!
Morning
good evening Ms2ger
So, did anything useful happen yesterday?
yeah man, I added Event.NONE
Mozilla implemented it first ;)
annevk: People use that or me⊙an  -- but annevk⊙an is easy to say.
Ms2ger: haha
Velmont, yeah, and then gmail claims he's called "me"
annevk: :)
argh
w3c validator http://jigsaw.w3.org/css-validator/#validate_by_uri+with_options
cannot be made to accept syntax like background: -moz-linear-gradient(top,  #878787,  #000000);
are there any known workarounds? :)
Moo^: is that valid CSS?
if it is, file a bug
MikeSmith: there is option to accept vendor prefixes
but apparently it is ignored for values
ah
that is still worth filing a bug
we have a developer who is actively working on updates to the CSS validator right now
but not sure how long he will be doing it, so strike while the iron's hot
MikeSmith: I stroke
thanks
hai
some e-mail here suggests a mechanism whereby UAs could hash passwords, and AryehGregor brings up the need for per-user hashing
per-user salting, rather
is there any reason the username couldn't be used as the salt?
Hixie: Sounds bad if you want to change the username later
(e.g. if you use email address as username, and the user changes their email address)
I'm now marking promoted tweets as spam
me too
aaaargh
so I do the forward thing
but Gmail keeps giving me "Delivery Status Notification (Failure)"
while when sending anything to the address does arrive at the address
it seems like DreamHost is blocking a particular kind of email from Gmail
